intro: Sisyrinchium stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It produces small, narrow leaves and has a clump-forming growth habit. Sisyrinchium stenophyllum is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
